newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Brent may probe lower, $19 is support.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Brent may probe lower, $19 is support.

text.p: NEARBY MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI-14 * MA-10 * MA-20
+ Brent may seek lower numbers on Thursday but the market will find a number of good support levels from $19 downwards.
+ U.S. markets are looking weak and this may provide a downwards bias this afternoon.

IPE Brent crude oil futures appear to be in a downwards corrective phase from this month's up move and the market is expected to move sideways or even a little lower still, but it is well supported at and below $19.00.
July IPE Brent closed just two cents a barrel firmer on Wednesday at $19.24, while June gas oil ended a dollar up at $173.00 a tonne.
"The market needed a correction and that is what we have seen," said Darren Gurner at Sucden in London. "But there is a pretty good band of support at $19.00 and below."
He said that $19.00 on the July contract chart was an important hurdle as a psychological level.
This is also the top of a gap on the front-month continuation chart dating from three weeks ago.
Beneath this number, Gurner added, lies a gap on the July chart at $18.80-$18.88, and then the 40-day moving average which currently weighs in at $18.78.
"If we break below that the market might start to look a little dodgy," he said.
Resistance would also be found at $19.88-$19.93, a chart gap from the weekend.
Fenella Graham at MeesPierson Derivatives said she saw a tight range for Brent between $19.12 and $19.32 on Thursday.
"We are looking to trade the range but the U.S. has a slightly negative bias so we will wait for rallies to sell."
"We will look for $19.48 to sell, or at best $19.64," she added, employing her company's Market Profile chart technique.
